name: renpyWarp
description: Quickly open Ren'Py at current line

renpyWarp.sdkPath.markdownDescription:
Path to the Ren'Py SDK. This is used to launch your game.

This should be an absolute path, or a path starting with `~` to indicate the home directory.

renpyWarp.strategy.markdownDescription: How to treat an existing Ren'Py instance when a warping command is issued.
markdownEnumDescriptions:
Automatically choose based what features are available in your version of Ren'Py.

Is slightly slower than the other options, as detection of features is required. If you know what features are available in your version of Ren'Py, you can choose a more specific strategy.
Launch a new instance of Ren'Py when a command is executed.

Execute `renpy.warp_to_line()` inside the open instance. This allows you to warp to a new line or file without restarting the game.

**NOTE**: This requires you to use a version of Ren'Py that supports the `exec.py` feature. As of writing this is only available in nightly builds.

renpyWarp.followCursorExecInterval.markdownDescription:
The interval in milliseconds to execute `renpy.warp_to_line()` when in follow cursor mode.

The lower the value, the more frequently the command is issued, which can feel more responsive.

Needs a restart to take effect.

renpyWarp.editor.markdownDescription:
The Editor class to use when opening files from inside Ren'Py. Should be a relative or absolute path to an `.edit.py` file.

Relative paths are resolved from the SDK path. For example, a valid value would be [`launcher/System Editor.edit.py`](https://github.com/renpy/renpy/blob/master/launcher/System%20Editor.edit.py).

This setting is equivalent to the environment variable [`RENPY_EDIT_PY`, as defined in Ren'Py's documentation](https://www.renpy.org/doc/html/editor.html).
